german: What thoughts do you associate with the word "purpose"?
Does mankind have a purpose?
What purpose do you see for your own life?
What is God's heart and purpose for humankind - for you?
How valuable are relationships for you and which are the most important? How would it be to be completly alone?
What are the essential emotional human needs?
How important is it for a person to be loved and accepted? What happens if those feeling are absent?
Do humans moral beings, do they have a consciousness, a sense of justice, creative capabilities and why?
Genesis 1:26-27.31 (ESV)
What does the text state about God and about human beings?
We are made in the likeness of God: What conclusions can we draw from imperfect human trades of charater (his morals etc.) about the nature of God?
Why do you think is God referring to himself as "us" in the text?
What does this text indicate about the value, dignity and destiny of every human being?
Matthew 22:37-40 (ESV)
What should characterize the relationship between human beings and God?
What would our society look like if we would put this commandment into practise?
What would our relationships look like?
What is God's intention with these commandments, and what can be concluded about His nature?
Ephesians 1:5 (ESV)
What characterizes the relationship between a child and his/her parents?
What is your take-home from this chapter?
What goals do you want to set for the upcoming weeks?
Purpose, Relationships (Family, Friends), Encounter with God
Have you ever been saved from danger?
Is the world, we live in, fair? Why or why not? What's wrong?
In your opinion: What does God demand of us?
Do you think you are a good person, and why?
By which standard are you making this assesment?
Are you meeting your own standards?
Matthew 15:19 (ESV)
Can you agree with this bible verse? Why or why not?
Do all thoughts turn into actions? Does that mean they're less evil?
What keeps us from putting evil thoughts into action?
Romans 6:23
What is sin?
What does this bible verse mean by "death?"
Would God be just if he wouldn't condemn sins?
What are the consequences of sin in our lives, in society, in our relationships? (Theft, murder, lies, envy, hate, unforgiveness, jealousy...)
How are you dealing with your guilt in your life? Why are you handling it that way?
Is it possible to make amends?
Where is this not possible, and why? What solution do you have for those instances?
What is the eternal life? When does eternal life begin?
How do we receive the gift of eternal life?
Luke 23:39-43 (ESV)
Did the criminal deserve to be saved? Why or why not?
Do you think he lived a good life?
What's the difference between the two criminals?
Why did the second criminal get saved?
2. Corinthians 5:21 (ESV)
What is your take-home from this chapter?
What keeps you from accepting the gift of Jesus that we've talked about?
Forgiveness and forgiving, salvation, getting to know Jesus
Where did you experience good and bad leadership?
What do you need to follow someone?
Luke 6:46 (ESV)
Matthew 7:21 (ESV)
What does Jesus ask of his followers?
"Practice what you preach" - Why?
What does the word "faith" mean to you, and how is it connected with your actions?
Acts 2:36 (ESV)
By whom and why was Jesus made Lord?
Under what conditions can you trust a leader?
What advantages and disadvantages can there be to follow a leader?
What kind of leader is Jesus?
YouTube Video: The Messiah
Do you think it's hard to follow Jesus and to obey his commandments? Why?
Ezekiel 36:26-27 (ESV)
Have you ever experienced things that hardened your heart or made it bitter?
What does it mean to have a living heart?
How is it possible to live according to God's will? Is failure allowed?
What do you think, how is it possible to get this new heart?

subtitle: The Center of the Will of Jesus

german: Matthew 22:37 (ESV)
Can you command/order love?
What does following Jesus' commandments have to do with our mind and our emotions?
Is it blind faith or am I allowed to use my mind/thoughts?
What is your take-home from this chapter?
Whom are you following? To which standards are you alining your life?
How do you think would your life like if Jesus were to be your Lord?
Do you believe you have set the right priorities in your life? How could you if necessary change them?
New heart, priorities, lordship of Jesus (areas of life)
What were your three most beautiful experiences with your father or mother?
What would you have wish for from your father/mother?
God introduces himself as our heavenly Father: Story of the Prodigal Son from the Bible - Luke 15:11-32 (ESV)
How would you describe the behavior of the son who is leaving the father? What is his motivation?
How do you think does the father feels when his son leaves him?
Why does the son turn back, and what are his apprehensions?
How does the father react when his son returns home? What surprises you?
Do you think this experience changed the son? Why or why not?
What do you think will motivate him to be a "good son" in the future and to keep turning back to his father when he makes a mistake?
Can I share my story of turning back to God with you?
How do you personally think God will welcome you when you turn back to Him?
What do you think is the Father's heartbeat for you? What does he want for your life?
How is your relationship with God right now?
Do you want to get to know him as your loving Father?
Experiencing God, turning back to God, forgiveness, identity as a loved child, reconciliation
Have you ever felt like a new person?
Where would you have liked to turn back time?
What do you know about baptism? What do you associate with it?
Should baptism be your own decision?
Acts 2:37-38 (ESV)
Romans 6:3-4 (ESV)

"...died and buried"- What does this mean in the context of baptism?
If we are to live a new life, what was the old one and how does it differ from the new one?
By what power should we live this new life? How is this power called?
Have you heard of miracles or the supernatural or have you experienced things like this yourself?
Do you believe in miracles or the supernatural? Are you open to such experiences?
Matthew 3:11 (ESV)
What have you heard about the baptism in the Holy Spirit so far?
What do you think does it mean to be baptized in Spirit and fire?
Luke 11:13 (ESV)
Acts 8:17 (ESV)
When is it possible for this baptism to take place, and how does it happen?
1. Corinthians 14:1.3-5 (ESV)
What thoughts are new to you in this bible verse?
What does your common sense tell you about this bible verse?
Why does God give these gifts to believers?
Do you think you (potentially) have any of these gifts?
May I pray for you for a prophetic word/ healing/ encounter with God?
What is your take-home from this chapter?
Would you like to be baptized?
Would you like to be baptized in the Holy Spirit?

Baptism, fresh start, baptism in the Holy Spirit, healing, miracles, encounters with God
